intro: Tarenna evansii, commonly known as the Madagascar star anise, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, dark blue or black berries that are used in traditional medicine. Tarenna evansii thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance and medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
